snippet: The Jerome Park Reservoir, which has been empty for years, is to be refilled as a water filtration plant nears completion, but it will still be off-limits to the public.
abstract: Jerome Park Reservoir in the Bronx, an important link in New York City’s water supply system, has been dry for past five years, generating complaints from area residents who miss radiant blue of the 94-acre basin along with its cooling breezes; city's Environmental Protection Dept has begun filling reservoir to test $3.2 billion filtration plant, but completion of project could take years, and residents will still be barred from access.
lead_paragraph: The Jerome Park Reservoir, which has been empty for years, is to be refilled as a water filtration plant nears completion, but it will still be off-limits to the public.

headline.main: Reservoir’s Neighbors Want More Than Return of Their Water Views
headline.print_headline: Reservoir’s Neighbors Want More Than Return of Their Water Views
